intro: Galeatella gloria-montis, commonly known as the glory mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Alps. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy surface, adapted to withstand cold and windy conditions. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and mountain slopes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
